hours_text:
## The Museum & The Batten Kill

* * *

Two fly fishing classics that are worth the pilgrimage.

[](https://amff.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/visitmuseum.jpg)

### The Museum

**Winter hours (November–May): Thursday–Saturday, 10am to 4pm.**  
**Summer hours (June–October): Tuesday–Saturday, 10am to 4pm.  

Admission is $10 for adults, $5 for kids (ages 5–14), $20 for families, and free for AMFF members and their guests. Closed major holidays. **  
  
Our museum in beautiful Manchester, Vermont, is truly a sight to see. An 1800s era farmhouse houses our impressive collection of angling history including over 40,000 artifacts from fly fishing legends, presidents, and common anglers alike. Prepare to be amazed. 

[](https://amff.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/battenkill_0001_battenkill2.jpg)

### The Batten Kill

Several small tributaries gather at Mt. Equinox to form the Batten Kill, from which the river flows fifty miles through southwestern Vermont and New York until it meets up with the Hudson River near Saratoga. The river winds through farmland and forest as if straight out of a painting, inspiring actual artists such as John Atherton and Norman Rockwell to set up residence along the ‘Kill and tap into its picturesque setting. [Fishing Licenses, Rules & Regulations](https://vtfishandwildlife.com/fish)

## Places To Stay

* * *

Every fly angler needs a place to hang their waders. Please consider a stay with our area lodging sponsors.

[](http://www.equinoxresort.com)

collections_text:
## Dive in & branch out

## TROUT & SALMON

From the biggest rivers to the smallest streams, classic coldwater fly fishing is as much art as it is science.

#### [See all things coldwater](https://amff.org/explore/?_tags=coldwater)

## SALTWATER

Whether you're casting a six-weight in an estuary or a sixteen-weight in the bluewater, fly fishing in the salt is always thrilling.

#### [See all things saltwater](https://amff.org/explore/?_tags=saltwater)

## WARMWATER

In terms of accessibility and variety from coast to coast, it's tough to beat the sweetwater.

#### [See all things warmwater](https://amff.org/explore/?_tags=warmwater)

[EXPLORE THE STREAM](https://amff.org/explore)

## We’re a member-driven museum striving to represent the entirety of fly fishing sport and culture. Help us expand our reach by becoming a member today.

__

### Support our mission

[Learn more about membership](https://amff.org/membership)

## Accessible to all

## Vermont campus

Our museum in beautiful Manchester, Vermont, houses our impressive collection of angling history, including over 40,000 artifacts from fly fishing legends, presidents, and common anglers alike.

#### [Visit us in Manchester](https://amff.org/visit-and-discover/)

## Missouri Gallery

The Leigh H. Perkins Hall at the Wonders of Wildlife National Museum and Aquarium features countless treasures from our permanent collection spread across 2,300+ square fee...
